title: AI for Healthcare: Diabetic Retinopathy Detection in India
summary: Google and AIIMS Delhi collaborated to deploy a CNN model detecting diabetic retinopathy from retinal scans, addressing a critical ophthalmology shortage in India.
content:
Case Study: AI Diabetic Retinopathy Screening

India has over 77 million diabetic patients — the second highest in the world. Diabetic retinopathy (damage to the retina from diabetes) is a leading cause of preventable blindness. There are fewer than 10,000 ophthalmologists in India, creating an enormous screening gap.

The AI Solution

Google Research partnered with AIIMS Delhi and Aravind Eye Hospital to develop and validate a deep learning model that analyses retinal photographs for signs of diabetic retinopathy. The CNN was trained on 128,000 retinal images and validated in clinical settings.

Results

The model achieved over 90% sensitivity and specificity — comparable to specialist ophthalmologists. Deployed in community health centres in rural India, it allows screening by trained technicians without specialist oversight.

Key Learning

AI in healthcare requires rigorous clinical validation, regulatory approval, and careful deployment planning. The India-specific context — local language interfaces, offline capability, low-cost hardware — shaped every design decision.
